alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 3:31AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Boyd, Greenup, Lawrence, Carter, southern Gallia, Lawrence, Mason, Cabell, Putnam, western Lincoln, southern Jackson and Wayne Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 330 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Lake Vesuvius to Sandy Hook. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Portsmouth, Ironton, Nitro, Grayson, Ripley, Louisa, Winfield, Coal Grove, Olive Hill, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Lake Vesuvius and Grayson Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 126 and 137. Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
